geometry.planar

Class LineSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.LineSegment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LineSegment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Implements functionality for line segments. The difference between a LineSegment and a Line is, that a Line is infinite and a LineSegment has a start and an endpoint.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      creates the p_no-th line segment of p_polyline for p_no between 1 and p_polyline.line_count - 2.
      LineSegment(PolylineShape p_shape, int p_no)
      Creates the p_no-th line segment of p_shape for p_no between 0 and p_shape.line_count - 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineSegment

        public LineSegment(Line p_start_line,
                   Line p_middle_line,
                   Line p_end_line)
        Creates a line segment from the 3 input lines. It starts at the intersection of p_start_line and p_middle_line and ends at the intersection of p_middle_line and p_end_line. p_start_line and p_end_line must not be parallel to p_middle_line.
        Parameters:
        p_start_line - a Line object.
        p_middle_line - a Line object.
        p_end_line - a Line object.

      • LineSegment

        public LineSegment(Polyline p_polyline,
                   int p_no)
        creates the p_no-th line segment of p_polyline for p_no between 1 and p_polyline.line_count - 2.
        Parameters:
        p_polyline - a Polyline object.
        p_no - a int.

      • LineSegment

        public LineSegment(PolylineShape p_shape,
                   int p_no)
        Creates the p_no-th line segment of p_shape for p_no between 0 and p_shape.line_count - 1.
        Parameters:
        p_shape - a PolylineShape object.
        p_no - a int.

      • change_length_approx

        public LineSegment change_length_approx(double p_new_length)
        Creates a new line segment with the same start and middle line and an end line, so that the length of the new line segment is about p_new_length.
        Parameters:
        p_new_length - a double.
        Returns:
        a LineSegment object.

      • intersection

        public Line[] intersection(LineSegment p_other)
        Looks up the intersections of this line segment with p_other. The result array may have length 0, 1 or 2. If the segments do not intersect the result array will have length 0. The result lines are so that the intersections of the result lines with this line segment will deliver the intersection points. If the segments overlap, the result array has length 2 and the intersection points are the first and the last overlap point. Otherwise the result array has length 1 and the intersection point is the the unique intersection or touching point. The result is not symmetric in this and p_other, because intersecting lines and not the intersection points are returned.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a LineSegment object.
        Returns:
        an array of Line objects.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(LineSegment p_other)
        Checks if this LineSegment and p_other contain a commen point
        Parameters:
        p_other - a LineSegment object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • overlaps

        public boolean overlaps(LineSegment p_other)
        Checks if this LineSegment and p_other contain a common LineSegment, which is not reduced to a point.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a LineSegment object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • stair_approximation

        public IntPoint[] stair_approximation(double p_width,
                                      boolean p_to_the_right)
        Constructs an approximation of this line segment by orthogonal stairs with integer coordinates. The length of the stairs will be at most p_stair_width. If p_to_the_right, the stairs will be to the right of this line segment, else to the left.
        Parameters:
        p_width - a double.
        p_to_the_right - a boolean.
        Returns:
        an array of IntPoint objects.

      • stair_approximation_45

        public IntPoint[] stair_approximation_45(double p_width,
                                         boolean p_to_the_right)
        Constructs an approximation of this line segment by 45 degree stairs with integer coordinates. The length of the stairs will be at most p_stair_width. If p_to_the_right, the stairs will be to the right of this line segment, else to the left.
        Parameters:
        p_width - a double.
        p_to_the_right - a boolean.
        Returns:
        an array of IntPoint objects.

      • border_intersections

        public int[] border_intersections(TileShape p_shape)
        Returns an array with the borderline numbers of p_shape, which are intersected by this line segment. Intersections at an endpoint of this line segment are only counted, if the line segment intersects with the interiour of p_shape. The result array may have lenght 0, 1 or 2. With 2 intersections the intersection which is nearest to the start point of the line segment comes first.
        Parameters:
        p_shape - a TileShape object.
        Returns:
        an array of int.

      • sort_endpoints_in_x_y

        public LineSegment sort_endpoints_in_x_y()
        Inverts the direction of this.middle, if start_point() has a bigger x coordinate than end_point(), or an equal x coordinate and a bigger y coordinate.
        Returns:
        a LineSegment object.
